render.tex: \title{Scalar Triple Product} \\ %text Properties and computing the Scalar Triple Product %

reason.tex: %text The scalar triple product of three vectors is expressed as $\ora{a}\cdot(\ora{b}\times\ora{c})$. It is computed as shown, % \begin{align} \ora{a}&=\vector{a_1}{a_2}{a_3} \\ \ora{b}&=\vector{b_1}{b_2}{b_3} \\ \ora{c}&=\vector{c_1}{c_2}{c_3} \\ \ora{a}\cdot(\ora{b}\times\ora{c})&= \left|\begin{array}{ccc}a_1 & a_2 & a_3 \\ b_1 & b_2 & b_3 \\ c_1 & c_2 & c_3 \end{array}\right| \end{align} \\ %text A key attributes of the vector triple product is circular shift invariance, i.e., % \begin{align} \ora{a}\cdot(\ora{b}\times\ora{c})= \ora{c}\cdot(\ora{a}\times\ora{b}) = \ora{b}\cdot(\ora{c}\times\ora{a}) \end{align}
